publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3171# Margaret Jamieson: Victims Rights—That the Parliament notes recent court decisions which put the human rights of prisoners before those of their victims by ignoring the rights of victims to pursue their assailant for damages when compensation is awarded and believes that the Scottish Executive should pursue all avenues to ensure that no convicted criminal has the opportunity to gain financially from their crimes or imprisonment and that victims should be advised of awards of compensation, inheritance or other financial gain. Supported by: John Home Robertson*, Bill Butler*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Jackie Baillie*
S2M-3171# Victims’ Rights (lodged on 19 August 2005) Mr Frank McAveety*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, John Swinburne*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Trish Godman*, Donald Gorrie*, Karen Gillon*
S2M-3171# Victims’ Rights (lodged on 19 August 2005) Brian Adam*, Mike Pringle*, Richard Baker*, Mr David Davidson*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-3171# Victims’ Rights (lodged on 19 August 2005) Janis Hughes*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S2M-3171# Victims’ Rights (lodged on 19 August 2005) Helen Eadie*, Cathy Peattie*
